intro: Notocampylum chevalieri, commonly known as the mountain gentian, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Himalayas. It belongs to the Gentianaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue or violet petals. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in cool, moist environments. Its flowers are tubular and attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Notocampylum chevalieri is valued for its ornamental beauty and is sometimes cultivated in alpine gardens.
